channel.title: 15. Basic Grammar: Present Tense Verbs – Regular and Irregular Verbs, Finally Explained! on Italiano con Geoff
channel.description: Recent content in 15. Basic Grammar: Present Tense Verbs – Regular and Irregular Verbs, Finally Explained! on Italiano con Geoff

item.title: Lesson 15.1: Regular Present Tense Verbs – The Well-Behaved Ones
item.description: Learn how to conjugate regular Italian verbs ending in -are, -ere, and -ire. Finally, some grammar that makes sense!

item.title: Exercise 15.1: Practice – Regular Present Tense Verbs
item.description: Practice conjugating regular -are, -ere, and -ire verbs in the present tense. No irregular surprises here!

item.title: Lesson 15.2: Irregular Present Tense Verbs – The Wild Ones
item.description: Not all verbs follow the rules. Meet ’essere’, ‘avere’, ‘andare’, and more — Italy’s most unpredictable grammar celebrities.

item.title: Exercise 15.2: Practice – The Irregulars!
item.description: Practice Italy’s most unpredictable verbs — essere, avere, andare, and fare — with fill-ins, translations, and a dramatic Geoff moment.

item.title: Lesson 15.3: Mix It Up – Regular & Irregular Verbs in Action
item.description: Let’s use everything! Regular and irregular verbs meet in everyday Italian dialogues — featuring Geoff, Viktor, and the great tomato conspiracy.

item.title: Exercise 15.3: Practice – The Great Verb Mix
item.description: Put regular and irregular verbs to the test in this final boss-level challenge. Warning: may contain pasta and suspicious tomatoes.
